newsitem.title: JAPAN: Taito sets up Chinese firm to operate game centres.
newsitem.headline: Taito sets up Chinese firm to operate game centres.

text.p: Taito Corp said it had set up a joint venture in China with Chinese and Australian companies to operate game centres and to manufacture game machines.
The company, Beijing Taixin Cultural Amusement Co Ltd, was established in Beijing with a capitalisation of $2 million, the company said in a statement.

The joint venture is expected to open its first game centre in Beijing by the end of this year, the statement said. A total of 110 game machines will be installed in the new centre, the statement said.
Taito will own 80 percent in the new firm, while the Chinese and Australian partners will hold the remainder, the statement said.
The joint venture plans to open three game centres in the first year of operation, the statement said.
